channel.title: Multiple Accounts
channel.description:
Ok, I know many people were stupid when they first joined (and possibly still are lol) and created multiple accounts before reading the rules. I was one of those people. After reading the rules I decided that I would never use it again, and I admitted to owning it and requested that it be banned, along with my apologies. The (mostly)wonderful staff here understood me, and banned my secondary account, with this message:
Sorry #####, you are banned from using this forum! Multiple accounts are against the rules. I'll keep your other account open. Thanks for being honest about it.
I just want to suggest that people understand that they WILL GET CAUGHT and they WILL GET PUNISHED. I highly recommend admitting your mistakes as to increase your chances for a lower punishment. Just food for thought, and a call to action.

item.title: Multiple Accounts
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“whip of soulz, post:33, topic:305879”][quote author=Explisionist link=topic=402094.msg2979991#msg2979991 date=1254551494]
This topic is kinda pointless…

Like all the staff says; if they can’t read the rules, than they will have to face the consequences.

Warning them is a waste of time, because by the time they click on this topic their ip is banned. <Lol
[/quote]yah but den day just cum bak fromz dem proxy sitez[/quote]

And when they are caught yet again, they loose any chance of ever appealing a ban.

This topic is useful and will remain open due to that alone. davidi2 is right in saying that honesty goes a long way. Most of the moderators will ban you in full if you are caught with multiple accounts. And seriously, 99% of the people caught with multiple accounts are total morons and don’t know the first thing about hiding their second, third, or fourth accounts. So to everyone reading this post, don’t be naive enough to think that you can beat the system, because you can’t.

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple Accounts

Lol when I didnt know what it meant I googled as well. But I had a feeling the disposal of bombs wasnt what he meant…

item.title: Multiple Accounts
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

I googled EoD to find out what it was and found:

Explosive Ordnance Disposal, the disposal of bombs End Of Day, a financial markets term Electric organ discharge, electric discharge generated by the organs of animals Esoteric Order of Dagon, a fictional cult in the Cthulhu mythos of H. P. Lovecraft End of Data character or signal in computing Evolution of Dance, a famous video on Youtube. Every other day fasting, a eating pattern in which a person eats one day, then fast for one day. Entrance on Duty, a reference to employment entry in government jobs. Equipment Operating Data, operating data used for public transport devices. Evans Organizational Development Organizational Development and Human Resource Solutions End of Discussion, used when the speaker believes he has stated his case and will not respond to further arguments or attacks.

Read full topic
